Module com.example.platformerplain
Package com.platformer.escape_beyond

Class Main

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.platformer.escape_beyond.Main
public class Main extends javafx.application.Application
The Main class serves as the entry point and lifecycle manager for this platformer game.

This class initializes core game components such as DataManager, TimeManager, and SceneManager. It sets up the primary stage, loads the initial game scene, and launches the game application.

The class extends Application to leverage the JavaFX framework for managing the game's graphical user interface (GUI) and scene transitions.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init() throws Exception
      Initializes the game's core managers and prepares the game environment before the GUI starts.

      This method is called once during the application's initialization phase, before the start(Stage) method. It initializes the DataManager and TimeManager to ensure that all game data and timers are properly configured.

      Overrides:
      init in class javafx.application.Application
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error during initialization.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
      Sets up and starts the primary stage for the game.

      This method is called once the JavaFX runtime is ready. It uses the SceneManager to configure the primary stage, set the initial scene, and display the game window.

      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the application, provided by the JavaFX runtime.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is any error during the setup or scene initialization.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main entry point of the game application.

      This method launches the JavaFX application by calling the Application.launch(String...) method. It initializes the JavaFX runtime and begins the application's lifecycle.

      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments passed to the application.
